intro: Gochnatia sagrana, commonly known as the golden gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gochnatia sagrana typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
